channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: S&P 500 futures and Treasury yields gain on Friday as March labor report shows resilient economy
item.description: Friday's jobs report runs counter to that weak data and is likely to divide investors.

item.title: Job growth totals 236,000 in March, near expectations as hiring pace slows
item.description: The Labor Department reported Friday that payrolls grew by 236,000 for the month, compared to the Dow Jones estimate for 238,000.

item.title: China's recovery is taking longer than expected, so Citi is pushing back its stock rebound forecasts
item.description: Earnings from Chinese e-commerce giants JD.com and Alibaba have also indicated that consumers remain conservative about spending.

item.title: Commerce officials heading to China to lay groundwork for possible Raimondo trip later this year, sources say
item.description: Officials from the Department of Commerce will travel to Beijing and Shanghai to lay groundwork for a potential trip by Secretary Gina Raimondo, sources say.

item.title: Diddy still pays Sting '$5,000 a day' for sampling his hit song 'Every Breath You Take' 26 years ago
item.description: Sting once joked that he 'put a couple of my kids through college' with the royalties he's gotten from Diddy over the years.

item.title: In Nicole Chung’s memoir, "A Living Remedy," she blames U.S. health care for her parents' early deaths
item.description: In Nicole Chung's new memoir, "A Living Remedy," she tells the story of watching her aging parents get sicker from illnesses they couldn't afford to treat.

item.title: France's Macron, EU chief call on China to mediate in Ukraine war
item.description: Two of Europe's top political heavyweights on Thursday held talks with China's President Xi Jinping at a time when the EU-Sino relationship is at a crossroads.

item.title: 1 in 3 people would quit for a 4-day workweek job, according to a new report
item.description: The four-day workweek is gaining momentum, and people say they're willing to quit to have it.

item.title: Here's a decade-by-decade guide to building wealth
item.description: Don't let market volatility and recession fears stop you from taking steps to build your wealth. Here's what you should be doing in your 20s, 30s and beyond.

item.title: A hidden time bomb? A 'Big Short' investor sees financial disaster brewing in housing markets
item.description: Dave Burt, CEO of investment research firm DeltaTerra Capital, believes an overlooked climate risk could see history repeating itself in the housing market.

item.title: Major trading platform CEO sees signs of a bond ETF revival
item.description: Two market experts find flows into bond ETFs are picking up following a lull.

item.title: These are the countries that will be 'most hit' if oil prices reach $100
item.description: OPEC+ announced an output cut of 1.16 million barrels per day, and some are forecasting $100 per barrel. That could hurt some countries more than others.

item.title: Tesla nominates ex-CTO JB Straubel to board of directors
item.description: Tesla has nominated former CTO JB Straubel to join its board of directors, according to a proxy filing out Thursday.

item.title: Australian regulator cancels Binance's license at exchange's own request
item.description: Facing a probe from the Australian Securities & Investments Commission, Binance asked the regulator to cancel its derivatives license.

item.title: Airlines' answer for congested airports and rising costs: Bigger planes
item.description: Airlines are turning to bigger planes that fit more travelers to handle strong demand.

item.title: Exhaustion pervades Russia and Ukraine's forces fighting for Bakhmut's ruins
item.description: A recent lull in fighting in Bakhmut has been down to poor weather and exhaustion, Western officials said.

item.title: Elon Musk wants to pause 'dangerous' AI development. Bill Gates disagrees—and he's not the only one
item.description: An open letter calling for a development pause on AI systems like ChatGPT has more than 13,500 signatures — but Bill Gates and AI developers are pushing back.

item.title: Starbucks customers are complaining about stomach issues from new olive oil-infused coffee
item.description: One customer described the Oleato beverage line as a "legit laxative."

item.title: March's banking chaos gave short sellers their biggest profits since the financial crisis
item.description: Short sellers were sitting on more than $7 billion in profit from the mass sell-off of bank shares last month, according to data firm Ortex.

item.title: Wind and solar power generators wait in yearslong lines to put clean electricity on the grid, then face huge interconnection fees they can't afford
item.description: Interconnection applications and fees make it slow and expensive for clean energy providers to connect to the electrical grid.

item.title: Think it's too late to switch jobs? Tell that to 'Asia's best female chef'
item.description: Lolla's Johanne Siy shares with CNBC Make It about how a "quarter-life crisis" changed the course of her career.

item.title: Virgin Orbit COO calls out company leadership for failures in goodbye memo. Read the full email
item.description: An email from Virgin Orbit's outgoing Chief Operating Officer Tony Gingiss appears to call out CEO Dan Hart, although not by name.

item.title: Disney names first brand chief as Iger refocuses on core properties
item.description: Disney named Asad Ayaz as its first-ever chief brand officer, as CEO Bob Iger works to refocus the company on its core entertainment properties.

item.title: 'We're not out of the woods': Sweden’s sliding house prices could be only halfway to the bottom
item.description: Sweden has long had one of Europe's hottest housing markets, but prices have tumbled, and are not set to recover for a long time, according to Danske Bank.

item.title: Michael Jordan sneakers, Kobe Bryant gear lead blockbuster Sotheby's auction
item.description: Michael Jordan's signed 1998 sneakers are the cornerstone of a two-part Sotheby's auction of game-worn sports memorabilia.

item.title: Shares of family-owned UAE exchange Al Ansari Financial Services surge in Dubai trading debut
item.description: Shares surged over 17% for the remittances and money exchange firm, which marks the first IPO for Dubai this year.

item.title: Sterling is the best performing G-10 currency this year, and strategists remain cautiously optimistic
item.description: The British pound is the best performing G-10 currency of 2023, and some strategists believe that the pound's rally can continue over the medium term.

item.title: Malaysia is back on investors' radar and wants to work with U.S. and China, says trade minister
item.description: Malaysia is determined to work with both the U.S. and China, Malaysia's trade minister told CNBC amid ongoing tensions between the two economic giants.

item.title: Here's when millions of UK phones will sound an emergency test alarm
item.description: Most U.K. cell phones will sound an alarm for 10 seconds later this month as the government tests a new emergency alert system.

item.title: IMF says U.S-China tensions could cost the world about 2% of its output
item.description: Companies and policymakers are exploring ways to make their supply chains more resilient by "moving production home or to trusted countries," the IMF said.
